title: Fall for Dance Festival
description: Fall for Dance Festival begins tonight, and kicking off the festival is the National Ballet of Ukraine's return to New York, for the first time since Ukraine declared its independence in 1991. The piece, Wartime Elegy, jump starts the 10-day festival on Sep 18 & 19 with a New York premiere that explores the impact of tragedy, and the triumph of the human spirit. Highlights include a visceral, rock & roll contemporary ballet set to U2 songs by Complexions Contemporary Ballet; an intimate, striking duet between two artists and a solo pianist by Boston Ballet; and a timeless piece by kNoname Artist â€“ Roderick George inspired by the HIV/AIDS Epidemic set to music by Donna Summer and Diana Ross.
